raw_response:
Thought: To determine if a number is prime, we need to check if it has any divisors other than 1 and itself. We can iterate from 2 up to the square root of the number, checking if it's divisible by any of those numbers. If no divisors are found, the number is prime.

```ruby
def is_prime?(num)
  return false if num <= 1
  
  (2..Math.sqrt(num)).none? { |i| num % i == 0 }
end
```

final_answer( answer: "The Ruby function to check if a number is prime is:" )
```ruby
def is_prime?(num)
  return false if num <= 1
  
  (2..Math.sqrt(num)).none? { |i| num % i == 0 }
end
```
